title: Understanding Chromatography
text: Chromatography is a technique used to separate components in a mixture. It relies on the differential partitioning between the mobile and stationary phases.

title: Types of Chromatography
text: Besides gas and liquid chromatography, there are other forms such as thin-layer chromatography, paper chromatography, and ion-exchange chromatography.

title: Identifying Other Chromatography Techniques
text: Which of the following is an example of a chromatography technique that is not gas or liquid chromatography?

title: Thin-layer Chromatography
text: Thin-layer chromatography (TLC) involves a stationary phase of a thin layer of adsorbent material on a flat, inert substrate. It is used for separating non-volatile mixtures.

title: Paper Chromatography
text: Paper chromatography uses a strip of paper as the stationary phase. It is often used for separating and identifying mixtures that are or can be colored, especially pigments.

title: Ion-exchange Chromatography
text: Ion-exchange chromatography separates ions and polar molecules based on their affinity to the ion exchanger. It is useful for proteins, amino acids, and nucleotides.
